title-part.text: AMMUNITION FUZES

reference.text: blasting cartridge initiators F42B3/10; chemical aspects C06C

title-part.text: ARMING OR SAFETY MEANS THEREFOR

reference.text: filling fuzes F42B33/02; fitting or extracting primers in or from fuzes F42B33/04; containers for fuzes F42B39/30

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Impact fuzes, i.e. fuzes actuated only by ammunition impact
with firing-pin structurally combined with fuze
operating by inertia of members on impact
for any direction of impact
with delayed action after ignition of fuze

CPC-specific-text.text: or after impact

title-part.text: the fuze activating a propulsive charge for propelling the ammunition or the warhead into the air, e.g. in rebounding projectiles
without firing-pin
with delayed action after ignition of fuze
operating at a predetermined distance from ground or target by means of a protruding member
Fuzes actuated by exposure to a liquid, e.g. seawater

reference.text: F42C5/00 takes precedence; time fuzes F42C9/00

title-part.text: Fuzes actuated by exposure to a predetermined ambient fluid pressure
barometric pressure
Fuzes actuated by application of a predetermined mechanical force, e.g. tension, torsion, pressure

reference.text: by ammunition impact F42C1/00, by exposure to a predetermined ambient fluid pressure F42C5/00

title-part.text: Contact fuzes, i.e. fuzes actuated by mechanical contact between a stationary ammunition, e.g. a land mine, and a moving target, e.g. a person
actuated by applying pressure on the ammunition head
and comprising pneumatic or hydraulic retarding means
of release type, i.e. actuated by releasing pressure from the ammunition head
of antenna type
Percussion fuzes of the double-action type, i.e. fuzes cocked and fired in a single movement, e.g. by pulling an incorporated percussion pin or hammer
Time fuzes
Combined time and percussion or pressure-actuated fuzes
Fuzes for timed self-destruction of ammunition
the timing being caused by mechanical means
by spring motor

reference.text: F42C9/141 takes precedence; housings for fuzes specially adapted for winding or setting F42C19/02

CPC-specific-text.text: the clockwork activating a security device, e.g. for unlocking the firing-pin
and the firing-pin being activated by impact
and the firing-pin being activated by a spring
and the activating spring being the spring of the clock-work mechanism
Unlocking of clockwork mechanisms, e.g. by inertia or centrifugal forces; Means for disconnecting the clockwork mechanism from the setting mechanism

title-part.text: by flow of fluent material, e.g. shot, fluids
the timing being caused by chemical action, e.g. of acids
the timing being caused by combustion
with ring combustion elements
Double fuzes
Multiple fuzes

CPC-specific-text.text: Impact fuze in combination with a clockwork time fuze
combined time and percussion fuzes in which the timing is caused by combustion
with ring or spiral combustion elements
combined time and percussion fuzes in which the timing is caused by chemical reaction
Impact fuze in combination with electric time fuze
Proximity fuzes in combination with other fuzes

title-part.text: for self-destruction of ammunition
when the spin rate falls below a predetermined limit, e.g. a spring force being stronger than the locking action of a centrifugally-operated lock
Electric fuzes

CPC-specific-text.text: in combination with other fuzes F42C9/14
safety or arming effected by electric means F42C15/40; electric contact parts for fuzes F42C19/06
F42B3/12 - F42B3/18; optical initiators F42B3/113
Electric circuits for fuzes characterised by the ammunition class or type

reference.text: F42C11/02 - F42C11/06 take precedence; mechanical fuzes having electric igniters for hand grenades or marine warheads F42C14/025, F42C14/045

CPC-specific-text.text: Smart ammunition fuzes, i.e. having an integrated scanning, guiding and firing system
for hand grenades
for marine warheads, e.g. torpedoes, mines, depth charges
for fall bombs
for land mines
Power generation in electric fuzes

reference.text: F42C11/02, F42C11/04 and F42C15/295 take precedence

title-part.text: with piezo-crystal
with current induction
with time delay by electric circuitry

CPC-specific-text.text: Programmable electronic delay initiators in projectiles

title-part.text: Proximity fuzes
Fuzes for remote detonation

reference.text: F42C9/148 takes precedence; constructional details F42C19/00; mounting of antennas F42B30/006

CPC-specific-text.text: operated by variations in electrostatic field
for non-guided, spinning, braked or gravity-driven weapons, e.g. parachute-braked sub-munitions

title-part.text: operated by intensity of light or similar radiation

CPC-specific-text.text: using active distance measurement
Remotely actuated projectile fuzes operated by optical transmission links

title-part.text: operated by radio waves

CPC-specific-text.text: based on distance determination by coded radar techniques
using transmission of F.M. waves
Remotely actuated projectile fuzes operated by radio transmission links

title-part.text: operated by sound waves
operated by variations in magnetic field

CPC-specific-text.text: Mechanical

title-part.text: fuzes characterised by the ammunition class or type
for hand grenades

CPC-specific-text.text: having electric igniters

title-part.text: for torpedoes, marine mines or depth charges

CPC-specific-text.text: having electric igniters

title-part.text: for fall bombs
for land mines
Arming-means in fuzes
Safety means for preventing premature detonation of fuzes or charges

CPC-specific-text.text: Combination-type safety mechanisms, i.e. two or more safeties are moved in a predetermined sequence to each other

title-part.text: wherein the firing pin is displaced out of the action line for safety
wherein a carrier for an element of the pyrotechnic or explosive train is moved
using a slidable carrier
using a rotatable carrier
rotatable in a plane which is parallel to the longitudinal axis of the projectile
by the action of centrifugal or inertia forces on the carrier body, e.g. the carrier having eccentrically mounted weights or eccentric centre of gravity
wherein a securing-pin or latch is removed to arm the fuze, e.g. removed from the firing-pin

CPC-specific-text.text: F42C9/041 and

title-part.text: using spring action
using centrifugal force
by unwinding a flexible ribbon or tape
wherein the safety or arming action is effected by inertia means
using centrifugal force
operated by flow of fluent material, e.g. shot, fluids
stored within the fuze housing
operated by fluidic oscillators
operated by dynamic fluid pressure, e.g. ram-air operated
operated by a turbine or a propeller
Mounting means therefor
of propellant gases, i.e. derived from propulsive charge or rocket motor
generated by the combustion of a pyrotechnic or explosive charge within the fuze
operated by change of fluid pressure
by breaking a vacuum or pressure container
wherein the safety or arming action is effected by a blocking-member in the pyrotechnic or explosive train between primer and main charge
wherein arming is effected by combustion or fusion of an element;

CPC-specific-text.text: Arming methods using temperature gradients

title-part.text: wherein arming is effected by chemical action
wherein the safety or arming action is effected electrically
from a remote location, e.g. for controlled mines or mine fields
Arrangements for disarming, or for rendering harmless, fuzes after arming, e.g. after launch
Fuze-setting apparatus
Fuze-setting keys
for electric fuzes
Details of fuzes
Fuze bodies
Fuze housings
Protective caps
Electric contact parts specially adapted for use with electric fuzes

reference.text: switches operated by change of speed H01H35/06; switches operated by change of acceleration, e.g. shock or vibration, inertia switches H01H35/14; fluid-pressure-operated switches H01H35/24

title-part.text: Nose-contacts for projectiles or missiles
Primers

reference.text: initiators for blasting cartridges F42B3/10; ignition means for rocket engine plants F02K9/95

title-part.text: Detonators

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the combination of per se known chemical composition in the priming substance
characterised by the particular configuration of the transmission channels from the priming energy source to the charge to be ignited, e.g. multiple channels, nozzles, diaphragms or filters
characterised by the generation of a plasma for initiating the charge to be ignited

Intermediate ignition capsules, i.e. self-contained primary pyrotechnic module transmitting the initial firing signal to the secondary explosive, e.g. using electric, radio frequency, optical or percussion signals to the secondary explosive

reference.text: initiators for blasting cartridges or air bags F42B3/10

CPC-specific-text.text: Primers or igniters for the initiation of rocket motors, i.e. pyrotechnical aspects thereof
Primers or igniters for the initiation or the propellant charge in a cartridged ammunition
comprising an elongated perforated tube, i.e. flame tube, for the transmission of the initial energy to the propellant charge, e.g. used for artillery shells and kinetic energy penetrators
characterised by the shape and configuration of the base element embedded in the cartridge bottom, e.g. the housing for the squib or percussion cap
Arrangements of a multiplicity of primers or detonators dispersed within a propellant charge for increased efficiency
Primers or igniters for the initiation or the explosive charge in a warhead
Arrangements of a multiplicity of primers or detonators, dispersed within a warhead, for multiple mode selection
Arrangements of a multiplicity of primers or detonators, dispersed within a warhead, for increased efficiency

title-part.text: Primers for caseless ammunition
Primers or detonators containing a hollow charge
Arrangements of a multiplicity of primers or detonators, dispersed around a warhead, one of the primers or detonators being selected for directional detonation effects
Percussion caps
electric
operable also in the percussion mode
Checking fuzes
Testing fuzes
Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
